meanings.definition: To make (something) worldwide in scope or application.
meanings.sent1: Companies often globalize their products to reach more customers.
meanings.sent2: The internet has helped globalize communication across the globe.
meanings.sent3: Trying to globalize a local food specialty may result in unexpected flavors.
meanings.sent4: Her contagious laughter seemed to globalize throughout the room.
meanings.sent5: The idea of peace should globalize to every corner of the world.

meanings.definition: To extend to all parts of the world.
meanings.sent1: The pandemic quickly globalized and affected every continent.
meanings.sent2: Travel has allowed cultures to globalize and share traditions.
meanings.sent3: The rumor about the new teacher globalized faster than a speeding train.
meanings.sent4: His passion for music globalized like wildfire, spreading to every listener.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh flowers globalized through the open windows, filling the room with fragrance.
